result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy H. Moon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeremy H. Moon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeremy H. Moon was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy H. Moon

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeremy H. Moon appeared with Attorney Hilary D Edwards.  Defendant in custody @ KCDC.  Attorney Angelina Gabriele appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance.  Ct 2 and 13CF1315 were dismissed and read-in.  Sentence:
Ct 1-Misd DC:
Defendant sentenced to 90 days in the KCJ, w/146 days sentence credit given.  Time served.  Court costs waived.  No restitution requested.  Appeal rights given.  Defendant may petition the court for expungement, in writing, after two years.
Case to be heard w/def's other two cases 13CF1308 & 13CF1315

Defendant Jeremy H. Moon appeared with Attorney Hilary D Edwards.  Defendant in custody @ KCDC.  Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:  Court accepts Br 7 case and to be heard w/def's other two cases, 13CF1308 & 13CF1315.  Defendant entered a plea of No Contest to Ct 1-Misd DC; found guilty by the court.  Ct 2 was dismissed and read-in.  Ct 3 was dismissed outright on 1/7/14.  PSI report ordered.  Bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 23, 2014 at 10:30 am, w/13CF1308 & 13CF1315.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:12am-  DE was not transported for this morning's hearing.  Attorney Edwards is requesting an adjournment as she has made arrangements for the DE to have a psychiatric exam.  Discussion held.  Court adjourns matter to May 7, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  11:18am-  DE was not brought over for today's hearing.  Attorney Edwards is requesting an adjournment as she was recently appointed.  DE has 2 pending cases before Judge Milisauskas.  Court grants request.  Final pre-trial adjourned to February 26, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Bond continued.
filed by Atty. Hilary Edwards  kmk

303pm  Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Chuck Bennett.  Clerk: LE  Referred to Br.7 for further disposition on 1/15/14 @ 10am w/co-deft.  Atty. Bennett moves to dismiss Ct.3.  Court grants motion.  $250  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  kmk
